title: TikTok to YouTube Video Converter App

requirements.text: Create a single-page app that lets a user paste a TikTok video URL, validates the URL, and initiates retrieval of the source video for conversion.

quotes: Make me a tik tok to YouTube video converter app

acceptanceCriteria: A user can paste a TikTok URL and click a primary action to proceed.
The UI shows clear validation errors for empty/invalid URLs.
The UI indicates loading/progress while retrieval/prep is happening.

requirements.text: Implement a conversion workflow that outputs a YouTube-ready MP4 file and allows the user to download it locally (no automatic upload to YouTube). Provide basic conversion presets for common YouTube formats (e.g., Shorts 9:16 and Standard 16:9) and show the chosen output settings before export.

quotes: Make me a tik tok to YouTube video converter app

acceptanceCriteria: The user can choose between at least two presets: YouTube Shorts (9:16) and YouTube Standard (16:9).
The app can export a downloadable MP4 file and the download completes successfully.
The UI displays the selected preset and key output settings (resolution/aspect) prior to export.
The app clearly states that YouTube upload is not performed by the app.

requirements.text: Add a results screen that previews the converted video in-browser and displays practical guidance for uploading to YouTube manually (step-by-step text).

quotes: Make me a tik tok to YouTube video converter app

acceptanceCriteria: After conversion, the user can play a preview of the converted video.
A clear set of upload instructions is displayed in English.
There is an obvious way to start over with a new TikTok URL.

requirements.text: Persist a lightweight conversion history (TikTok URL, timestamp, chosen preset, output filename) so users can revisit prior conversions from the UI. Do not store raw video bytes on the backend.

quotes: Make me a tik tok to YouTube video converter app

acceptanceCriteria: After a conversion completes, a history entry is saved and appears in a History section.
History entries persist across page reloads.
Backend data does not store video file contents (only metadata).
A user can delete individual history entries from the UI.

requirements.text: Define a coherent, distinctive visual theme for the app (colors, typography, spacing, component styling) and apply it consistently across all screens. Do not use a blue+purple palette.
acceptanceCriteria: The UI uses a consistent, intentional theme across the converter flow and history view.
The theme avoids a primary blue+purple aesthetic.
Key actions (Convert/Export/Download) are visually prominent and accessible.

requirements.text: Add generated static image assets (logo and simple hero illustration) and render them in the UI (e.g., header/logo and landing/empty state). Store images under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference them directly from the frontend.
acceptanceCriteria: The app includes and displays the generated logo image.
The app includes and displays the generated hero/empty-state illustration image.
Images are served as static assets from frontend/public/assets/generated (not via backend).

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (all backend logic in backend/main.mo).
Do not edit files under frontend immutablePaths (compose UI using existing components instead).
Do not implement direct YouTube upload (OAuth / third-party auth integrations are out of scope for this build).
Do not store or persist raw video bytes in canister stable state.
nonGoals: Watermark removal guarantees for all TikTok URLs (the app should not claim bypassing platform restrictions).

required: Minimal modern logo mark featuring a stylized play button and conversion arrows, warm neutral palette (tt2yt-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Flat illustration of a phone video transforming into a widescreen video frame, warm neutral palette, no text (tt2yt-hero.dim_1600x900.png)
